In the distant past, Hingashi's great lords vied for supremacy over its seagirt confines in a long and bloody conflict. And taking to battle in their lieges' names were noble swordsmen whose art was forged in the crucible of war: the samurai.

Key Attribute: STRENGTH or DEXTERITY

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Strength or Dexterity

Hit Points: 8 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

Roleplaying the Samurai

During Combat Encounters...

You strike with unmatched accuracy and speed and use combat techniques coming from a long training. A samurai draws his power from his devastating blows who destabilize his victims, and his ability to focus makes him an unparalleled fighter.

During Social Encounters...

You are a intimidating presence who can prove useful when negotiating with your enemies or a force of nature who knows how to be courteous with nobility.

While Exploring...

You are always on the alert and ready to make amends for the slightest affront. You overcome physical challenges in your own way, cutting through doors and obstacles as needed, climbing with ease and jumping over pits.

In Downtime...

You can perform advanced ancient traditions, perform the tea ceremony or interact with local nobility. You may seek to learn martial or craft techniques from other masters to elevate them to an art form. If you have performed honorably, you may rise in your master's organization or become a powerful daimyo in your own right.

You Might...

  • Know the purpose and quality of every weapon and piece of armor you own.
  • Recognize that the danger of an adventurer's life must be balanced out with great revelry or ambitious works.
  • Have little patience for puzzles or problems that require detailed logic or study.

Others Probably...

  • Find you intimidating until they really know you - and maybe even after they get to know you better.
  • Respect your expertise in the art of war and your traditions.
  • See you as an honorable person.

Clad in heavy armor and unimpeachable ideals, you stride onto the battlefield assured in your safety. Using your peerless defenses, you protect those near to you and live to tell the tale.

Key Attribute: STRENGTH

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Strength

Hit Points: 12 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

Roleplaying the Paladin

During Combat Encounters...

You confront enemies in close combat while carefully positioning yourself to protect your allies.

During Social Encounters...

You use your knowledge of politics to hold your own on the court just as well as on the battlefield.

While Exploring...

You lead the way into the unknown, ready to leap to your allies' defense at a moment's notice.

In Downtime...

You might spend your downtime in rigorous training, solemn contemplation, or perhaps just pursuing your own hobbies or interests.

You Might...

  • Be a selfless individual willing to throw yourself into harm's way for a cause you believe in.
  • You might also be a bit of a glutton for punishment, throwing yourself into harm’s way out of some need to feel useful.
  • Be seen as rigid and unyielding, much to the consternation of your allies and your lord (if applicable).

Others Probably...

  • See you as a light in the darkness.
  • Know that you’ve sworn an oath of some kind, and can be trusted to uphold it.
  • Worry that you might be unreasonable or be unwilling to compromise in desperate circumstances.

Equipped with naught but your brain, your multi-tool and potentially a mechanical suit to assist you, you stride onto the battlefield to show to your foes what true technological superiority looks like!

Key Attribute: INTELLIGENCE

At 1st level, your class gives you an attribute boost to Intelligence

Hit Points: 8 plus your Constitution modifier

You increase your maximum number of HP by this number at 1st level and every level thereafter.

Roleplaying the Engineer

During Combat Encounters...

You rely on your inventions as much as possible, testing their functionalities under a variety of conditions. You don't set out to achieve anything as banal as simply winning a fight; you seek to collect valuable data that can be used to improve your creations!

During Social Encounters...

You provide useful context when discussing a variety of academic topics, particularly when speaking about those subjects related to crafting and invention. You might often look for opportunities to acquire patronage to fund some of your more expensive or unorthodox experiments. After all, the materials needed to assemble your inventions don't pay for themselves!

While Exploring...

You study the design and construction of the environments you explore ardently, making note of clever traps, ingenious mechanisms, or especially keen architecture you come across for later.

In Downtime...

You brainstorm new designs, bringing them to fruition through careful crafting and meticulous attention to detail. You might also modify previous inventions to adjust for data you've collected in the field. You might work as a local smith or tinker where your skills are needed, or you might keep a workshop on the edge of town where the clank and clatter of your experiments attracts less attention.

You Might...

  • Be a very intelligent individual, full of bustling ideas.
  • You might also have a penchant for gathering engineering reagents.
  • Have an unhealthy degree of attention towards constructs and building your own mech.

Others Probably...

  • See you as a master of technology.
  • View your technology as little more than an esoteric field of aetherlogical study.
  • Expect you to have the answers to all of their problems.
